subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and J2EE testing
msgSnippet: ... You can go further: business logic should not know that they use a database and that they will be used by EJBs. This way you can test the business logic
messageBody:
rvdamle wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> One of our clients have implemented JUnit with EJB's as follows.
>
> Junit code is calling EJB methods ( which directly have DB calls based
> on Hibernate)and then checking DB via hibernate objects.
> Tests are run manually and of course they need container running.
>
> Is this the OK this way? Can we call this as unit testing?
> Ideally I think DB logic should be encapsulated in Business Objects
> which can be tested with JUnit instead of EJBs.

You can go further: business logic should not know that they use a
database and that they will be used by EJBs. This way you can test the
business logic without worrying about the correctness of pure
infrastructure.

In general, I prefer tests that don't need external resources like
containers and databases. They are easier to run, faster to execute and
drive me towards better designs.
--
